name: fortinet-fortirecon-brand-protection
label: Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection
description: FortiRecon is a Digital Risk Protection Service (DRPS) product that provides an outside-the-network view to the risks posed to your enterprise.

fields.name: server_url
fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Server name or IP address to which you will connect and perform the automated operations

fields.name: api_key
fields.title: API Key
fields.description: API key to access the endpoint to which you will connect and perform the automated operations

fields.name: org_id
fields.title: Organization ID
fields.description: Specify the organization Id for which you will perform the search

fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.
By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Search Alerts
operations.description: Get list of alerts(reports) published by FortiRecon for the given organisation.

parameters.name: relevance_rating
parameters.title: Relevance Rating
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific relevance rating. Multiple relevance ratings should be comma separated, example:Medium,High,Low.
parameters.description: Filter by specific relevance rating. Multiple relevance ratings should be comma separated, example:Medium,High,Low.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.title: Tags
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific tag. Multiple tags should be comma separated, example:phishing,malware,exploited
parameters.description: Filter by specific tag. Multiple tags should be comma separated, example:phishing,malware,exploited

parameters.name: adversary
parameters.title: Adversary
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific adversary(actor names, APT groups). Multiple adversary should be comma separated, example:apt35,foo,bar
parameters.description: Filter by specific adversary(actor names, APT groups). Multiple adversary should be comma separated, example:apt35,foo,bar

parameters.name: source_category
parameters.title: Source Category
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific source category. Acceptable values are: Darknet,OSINT,Technical Intelligence. Multiple source categories should be comma separated, example: Darknet,OSINT,Technical Intelligence
parameters.description: Filter by specific source category. Acceptable values are: Darknet,OSINT,Technical Intelligence. Multiple source categories should be comma separated, example: Darknet,OSINT,Technical Intelligence

parameters.name: report_type
parameters.title: Report Type
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific report type. Acceptable values are: Flash Report, Flash Alert, Threat alert,Threat report. Multiple report types should be comma separated, example: Flash Report,Flash Alert,Threat alert,Threat report
parameters.description: Filter by specific report type. Acceptable values are: Flash Report, Flash Alert, Threat alert,Threat report. Multiple report types should be comma separated, example: Flash Report,Flash Alert,Threat alert,Threat report

parameters.name: industry
parameters.title: Industry
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific industry. Multiple industries should be comma separated, example: manufacturing, government,hospitality.
parameters.description: Filter by specific industry. Multiple industries should be comma separated, example: manufacturing, government,hospitality.

parameters.name: geography
parameters.title: Geography
parameters.placeholder: example: south america,western europe, east asia,africa.
parameters.tooltip: Filter by geography. Multiple geographies should be comma separated, example: south america,western europe, east asia,africa.
parameters.description: Filter by geography. Multiple geographies should be comma separated, example: south america,western europe, east asia,africa.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific keyword in these fields:Report ID, Report Title, Report Summary, Report Content, Source Category. Actors, Motivation, Threats, Industry Tags.
parameters.description: Filter by specific keyword in these fields:Report ID, Report Title, Report Summary, Report Content, Source Category. Actors, Motivation, Threats, Industry Tags.

parameters.name: source_reliability
parameters.title: Source Reliability
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific source reliability.
parameters.description: Filter by specific source reliability.Acceptable values are:A-Reliable,B-Usually reliable,C-Fairly reliable,D-Not usually reliable,E-Unreliable,F-Cannot be judged.

parameters.name: information_reliability
parameters.title: Information Reliability
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific information reliability. Acceptable values are:1-Confirmed,2-Probably true,3-Possibly true,4-Doubtfully true,5-Improbable,6-Cannot be judged. Multiple information reliabilities should be comma separated, example: 1-Confirmed,2-Probably true
parameters.description: Filter by specific information reliability. Acceptable values are:1-Confirmed,2-Probably true,3-Possibly true,4-Doubtfully true,5-Improbable,6-Cannot be judged. Multiple information reliabilities should be comma separated, example: 1-Confirmed,2-Probably true

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Filter by report published date ,Default is Current Date
parameters.description: Filter by report published date ,Default is Current Date

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Filter by report published date, default is today's date.
parameters.description: Filter by report published date, default is today's date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.description: Page number from which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.description: Maximum number of records that this operation should return for the current page

operations.title: Get Alert Details By Alert ID
operations.description: Get alert details by alert ID

parameters.title: Alert ID
parameters.tooltip: Alert ID
parameters.description: Alert ID

operations.title: Get Phishing Campaigns
operations.description: Get list of phishing campaigns discovered by FortiRecon's Watermarks for the given organisation.

parameters.title: Page
parameters.description: Page number from which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.description: Maximum number of records that this operation should return for the current page

operations.title: Get Phishing Campaigns By ID
operations.description: Get specific of phishing attempt by its id discovered by FortiRecon for the given organisation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.title: Phishing Campaign ID
parameters.tooltip: Phishing Campaign ID
parameters.description: Phishing Campaign ID

operations.title: Get Rogue Apps
operations.description: Get list of Rogue Apps, also called Rogue Mobile Applications, are fake apps that try to look like apps from trusted brands discovered by FortiRecon for the given organisation.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.description: Filter by specific Rogue App status type. Official:published by officially recognized user/s, Unofficial:apps published by user/s that are NOT recognized officially, RogueApps:unofficial apps deemed to be potentially malicious, Threat alert,Threat report.
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific Rogue App status type. Official:published by officially recognized user/s, Unofficial:apps published by user/s that are NOT recognized officially, RogueApps:unofficial apps deemed to be potentially malicious, Threat alert,Threat report.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific keyword in these fields: Keyword, Source Name, Developer Name, App Name
parameters.description: Filter by specific keyword in these fields: Keyword, Source Name, Developer Name, App Name

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.description: Page number from which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.description: Maximum number of records that this operation should return for the current page

operations.title: Get Rogue App By ID
operations.description: Get Rogue Details App By Rogue app ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.title: Rogue App ID
parameters.description: Rogue App ID

operations.title: Get Takedown Requests
operations.description: Get list of takedown requests for rogue apps, typo domains for the given organisation.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific status type.
parameters.description: Filter by specific status type.

parameters.name: category
parameters.title: Category
parameters.description: Filter by specific category.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific keyword in these fields: ticketId, entity (it may be domain name, title of a report, Phished Domain, etc)
parameters.description: Filter by specific keyword in these fields: ticketId, entity (it may be domain name, title of a report, Phished Domain, etc)

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Filter by the Date on which the Takedown was requested.default is last 6 months.
parameters.description: Filter by the Date on which the Takedown was requested, default is last 6 months.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Filter by the Date on which the Takedown was requested.default is today's date.
parameters.description: Filter by the Date on which the Takedown was requested, default is today's date.

operations.title: Get Typo Domains
operations.description: Get list typo domains, also called Typosquatting, also called URL hijacking, a sting site, or a fake URL, is a form of cybersquatting, discovered by FortiRecon for the given organisation.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific domain status. Acceptable values are: Non-Functional,Offline,Online.
parameters.description: Filter by specific domain status. Acceptable values are: Non-Functional,Offline,Online.

parameters.name: original_domain
parameters.title: Original Domain
parameters.tooltip: Filter by specific a original domain. Multiple domains should be comma separated, example: example.com,test.com
parameters.description: Filter by specific a original domain. Multiple domains should be comma separated, example: example.com,test.com

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.description: Filter by specific keyword in these fields

parameters.name: severity
parameters.title: Severity
parameters.tooltip: Should be string ex.1 50to80, ex.2 0to80
parameters.description: Should be string ex.1 50to80, ex.2 0to80

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Filter by WhoIS Date (date found in the whois record for that domain) , default is last 6 months.
parameters.description: Filter by WhoIS Date (date found in the whois record for that domain) , default is last 6 months.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Filter by WhoIS Date (date found in the whois record for that domain), default is today's date.
parameters.description: Filter by WhoIS Date (date found in the whois record for that domain), default is today's date.

parameters.title: Page
parameters.description: Page number from which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.description: Maximum number of records that this operation should return for the current page
